00034     // understand it's a person-derived label and not some weird kernel thing.

00048 // Path must have trailing "/"
00049 #define CPU_EXCLUSIVE_ON(path)  std::string(ECHO_ON + (path) + "cpu_exclusive")
00050 #define CPU_EXCLUSIVE_OFF(path) std::string(ECHO_OFF + (path) + "cpu_exclusive")

00053 #define MEM_EXCLUSIVE_OFF(path) std::string(ECHO_OFF + (path) + "mem_exclusive")

00097 cpuset::cpuset(void):
00098     name_(new std::string(cpuset_constants::ROOT_NAME)),
00099     path_(new std::string(CPUSET_PATH)),
00100     CPUs_(new cpu_vector_t()),
00101     pids_(new pid_vector_t()),
00102     cpu_is_exclusive_(true),
00103     mem_is_exclusive_(true),
00104     migrate_memory_(false),
00105     notify_on_release_(false),
00106     parent_(0),
00107     children_()
00108 {
00109     int ret;
00110     unsigned tries = 0;
00111 
00112     if (number_cpus_)
00113         CS_RUNTIME("To be used only once to create root cpuset!");
00114 
00115     number_cpus_ = utility::how_many_cpus();
00116 
00117 try_again:
00118     ret = mkdir(CP(path_), 0755);
00119     if (ret)
00120     {
00121         if (errno == EEXIST)
00122         {
00123             if (!tries)
00124                 CS_CPRINT("Root set exists.  Failed to cleanup?  "
00125                           "Trying to purge\n");
00126 
00127             ++tries;
00128             if (tries < TRIES)
00129             {
00130                 remove_root_cpuset();
00131                 goto try_again;
00132             }
00133 
00134             // Screw it, we'll just use it
00135             CS_WARNING("Root cpuset exists and we couldn't remove it: "
00136                        "there may be existing child sets.\n"
00137                        "Attempting to continue.\n");
00138             return;
00139         }
00140 
00141         CS_ERROR("%s: failed to create path at '%s'", CP(name_), CP(path_));
00142     }
00143 
00144     ret = mount(C(ROOT_LABEL), CP(path_), "cpuset", 0, 0);
00145     if (ret)
00146         CS_ERROR("Couldn't create root cpuset at '%s'", CP(path_));
00147 
00148     CPUs_->reserve(number_cpus_);
00149     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < number_cpus_; ++i)
00150         CPUs_->push_back(i);
00151 
00152     // leave pids_ empty for lack of anything better
00153 }

00159 cpuset::cpuset
00160 (
00161     const std::string &name,
00162     const std::string &cpus,
00163     cpuset *parent_cpuset,
00164     bool cpu_is_exclusive,
00165     bool mem_is_exclusive,
00166     bool migrate_memory,
00167     bool notify_on_release
00168 ):
00169     name_(new std::string(name)),
00170     path_(),
00171     CPUs_(new cpu_vector_t()),
00172     pids_(new pid_vector_t()),
00173     cpu_is_exclusive_(cpu_is_exclusive),
00174     mem_is_exclusive_(mem_is_exclusive),
00175     migrate_memory_(migrate_memory),
00176     notify_on_release_(notify_on_release),
00177     parent_(parent_cpuset),
00178     children_()
00179 {
00180     if (!number_cpus_)
00181         CS_RUNTIME("Don't know how many CPUs are in system: "
00182                    "call set_cpu_count() before using!");
00183 
00184     int ret;
00185     std::string cpulist_parsed;
00186     std::string cmd;
00187     std::string base_path((parent_ ? parent_->path() : CPUSET_PATH));
00188     path_ = new std::string(base_path + name + "/");
00189 
00190     // Check for parent's directory
00191     cmd = DIR_EXISTS_COMMAND + base_path;
00192     ret = system(C(cmd));
00193     if (ret)        // test of parent directory failed: didn't return 0
00194         CS_ERROR("%s: couldn't create cpuset: directory of parent '%s' "
00195                  "not found?", C(name), C(parent_->name()));
00196 
00197     // See if list of CPUs is valid before creating subdirectory: less to
00198     // clean up if it isn't.
00199     parse_cpulist(cpus, &cpulist_parsed);
00200 
00201     // make the child directory
00202     ret = mkdir(CP(path_), 0755);
00203     if (ret)
00204         CS_ERROR("%s: failed to create path at '%s'", CP(name_), CP(path_));
00205 #if 0
00206     // go to that directory
00207     ret = chdir(CP(path_));
00208     if (ret)
00209         CS_ERROR("Couldn't move to cpuset dir for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00210                  CP(name_), CP(path_));
00211 #endif
00212 
00213     try
00214     {
00215         add_cpulist_to_cpuset(cpulist_parsed);
00216     } catch (std::exception &e)
00217     {
00218         CS_CPRINT("Failed setting cpus for '%s': trying to clean up",CP(name_));
00219         ret = rmdir(CP(path_));
00220         if (ret)
00221             CS_REPORT("%s: failed to remove CPUset: rmdir() failed", CP(name_));
00222         delete name_;
00223         delete path_;
00224         delete CPUs_;
00225         delete pids_;
00226         // Can't have children yet: this is the constructor.
00227         throw;
00228     }
00229 
00230     // set the various variables
00231     ret = system(cpu_is_exclusive
00232                  ? C(CPU_EXCLUSIVE_ON(*path_))
00233                  : C(CPU_EXCLUSIVE_OFF(*path_)));
00234     if (ret)
00235         CS_ERROR("configuring cpu_exclusive for cpuset '%s'", CP(name_));
00236 
00237     ret = system(mem_is_exclusive
00238                  ? C(MEM_EXCLUSIVE_ON(*path_))
00239                  : C(MEM_EXCLUSIVE_OFF(*path_)));
00240     if (ret)
00241         CS_ERROR("configuring mem_exclusive for cpuset '%s'", CP(name_));
00242 
00243     ret = system(migrate_memory
00244                  ? C(MEM_MIGRATE_ON(*path_))
00245                  : C(MEM_MIGRATE_OFF(*path_)));
00246     if (ret)
00247         CS_ERROR("configuring memory_migrate for cpuset '%s'", CP(name_));
00248 
00249     ret = system(notify_on_release
00250                  ? C(RELEASE_NOTIFY_ON(*path_))
00251                  : C(RELEASE_NOTIFY_OFF(*path_)));
00252     if (ret)
00253         CS_ERROR("configuring notify on release for cpuset '%s'", CP(name_));
00254 
00255     parent_->children_.push_back(this);
00256 }
00257 
00262 void
00263 cpuset::remove_root_cpuset(void)
00264 {
00265     int ret = umount(CP(path_));
00266     if (ret)
00267         CS_REPORT("%s: failed to unmount cpuset", CP(name_));
00268 
00269     ret = rmdir(CP(path_));
00270     if (ret)
00271         CS_REPORT("%s: failed to remove CPUset: rmdir() failed", CP(name_));
00272 }
00273 
00279 cpuset::~cpuset(void)
00280 {
00281     int ret;
00282 
00283     CS_CPRINT("Deleting CPU set with name '%s'\n", CP(name_));
00284 
00285     // delete children
00286     cpuset_vector_t::iterator i = children_.begin();
00287     cpuset_vector_t::iterator e = children_.end();
00288     for ( ; i != e; ++i)
00289     {
00290         CS_CPRINT("Deleting child '%s'\n", C((*i)->name()));
00291         delete *i;
00292     }
00293 
00294     ret = chdir("/");
00295     if (ret)
00296         CS_REPORT("%s: unable to \"cd /\" in order to unmount set", CP(name_));
00297 
00298     if (parent_)
00299     {
00300         ret = rmdir(CP(path_));
00301         if (ret)
00302             CS_REPORT("%s: failed to remove CPUset: rmdir() failed", CP(name_));
00303     } else
00304         remove_root_cpuset();
00305 
00306     delete name_;
00307     delete path_;
00308     delete CPUs_;
00309     delete pids_;
00310 }

00316 bool
00317 cpuset::bad_cpu(cpuid_t cpu_num) const
00318 {
00319     return cpu_num >= number_cpus_;
00320 }
00321 
00329 cpuid_t
00330 cpuset::insert_cpu(const std::string &cpu_string)
00331 {
00332     if (cpu_string.length() == 0)
00333         CS_RUNTIME("%s: 0 length CPU list", CP(name_));
00334 
00335     cpuid_t cpu = static_cast<cpuid_t>(atoi(C(cpu_string)));
00336     if (cpu >= number_cpus_)
00337         CS_RUNTIME("%s: Illegal CPU # %u", CP(name_), cpu);
00338 
00339     CPUs_->push_back(cpu);
00340     return cpu;
00341 }
00342 
00371 void
00372 cpuset::parse_cpulist(const std::string &cpus, std::string *cpu_list)
00373 {
00374 # if 0
00375     #define X(text) std::string(text)
00376 
00377     // errno doesn't get set correctly for system
00378     std::string cmd(X("/bin/echo ") + cpus + X(" > cpus"));
00379     int ret = system(C(cmd));
00380     if (ret)
00381         CS_RUNTIME("%s: Failed adding cpus", CP(name_));
00382 
00383     #undef X
00384 #else
00385     // For each character in string
00386     cpuid_t cpu = 0;
00387     std::string cpu_string;
00388     bool numeric = false;
00389 
00390     enum cpu_state { NONE, IN_VALUE, IN_RANGE };
00391     cpu_state state = NONE;
00392 
00393     std::string::const_iterator i = cpus.begin();
00394     const std::string::const_iterator e = cpus.end();
00395 
00396     for ( ; i != e; ++i)
00397     {
00398         char c = *i;
00399         numeric = ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9'));     // numeric data?
00400         switch (state)
00401         {
00402 
00403         case IN_VALUE:
00404             if (numeric)
00405             {
00406                 cpu_string += c;                   // append digit to string
00407             } else
00408             {
00409                 if (c == '-')                      // 1st CPU in range
00410                 {
00411                     cpu = insert_cpu(cpu_string);
00412                     cpu_string.clear();
00413                     state = IN_RANGE;
00414                 } else if (c == ',')               // singleton
00415                 {
00416                     cpu = insert_cpu(cpu_string);
00417                     cpu_string.clear();
00418                     state = NONE;
00419                 } else
00420                 {
00421                     CS_RUNTIME("%s: CPU list for cpuset: '%s' -> '%s'",
00422                                CP(name_), C(cpus), C(cpu_string));
00423                 }
00424             }
00425             break;
00426 
00427         case IN_RANGE:
00428             if (numeric)            // upper value on range
00429             {
00430                 cpu_string += c;
00431             } else if (c == ',')   // end range, begin new range, list || value
00432             {
00433                 // could happen with, e.g. "1-,"
00434                 if (cpu_string.length() == 0)
00435                     CS_RUNTIME("bad CPU range for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00436                                CP(name_), C(cpus));
00437 
00438                 cpuid_t low_cpu = cpu;
00439                 cpu = atoi(C(cpu_string)); // last CPU in range
00440                 if (bad_cpu(cpu))
00441                     CS_RUNTIME("%s: Illegal upper range CPU %u > max %u: %s",
00442                                CP(name_), cpu, number_cpus_, C(cpus));
00443                 cpu_string.clear();
00444                 state = NONE;
00445 
00446                 // add all CPUs in range to CPUset (inclusive range)
00447                 for ( ; low_cpu <= cpu; ++low_cpu)
00448                     CPUs_->push_back(low_cpu);
00449 
00450             } else
00451                 CS_RUNTIME("malformatted CPU list for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00452                            CP(name_), C(cpus));
00453             break;
00454 
00455         case NONE:
00456             if (numeric)
00457             {
00458                 cpu_string += c;           // append digit to string
00459                 state = IN_VALUE;
00460             } else
00461                 CS_RUNTIME("%s: Non-numerical while not parsing CPU: %s",
00462                            CP(name_), C(cpus));
00463 
00464             break;
00465         default:
00466             CS_RUNTIME("malformatted CPU list for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00467                        CP(name_), C(cpus));
00468         }
00469     }
00470 
00471     // What we were doing when string ended?
00472     switch (state)
00473     {
00474 
00475     case IN_VALUE:  // working on a singleton
00476         insert_cpu(cpu_string);
00477         cpu_string.clear();
00478         break;
00479 
00480     case IN_RANGE:
00481         if (numeric)
00482         {
00483             cpuid_t low_cpu = cpu + 1;
00484             cpu = atoi(C(cpu_string)); // last CPU in range
00485             if (bad_cpu(cpu))
00486                 CS_RUNTIME("Illegal upper range CPU %u in cpuset %s: %s",
00487                            cpu, CP(name_), C(cpus));
00488 
00489             // add all CPUs in range to CPUset (inclusive range)
00490             for ( ; low_cpu <= cpu; ++low_cpu)
00491                 CPUs_->push_back(low_cpu);
00492 
00493         } else  // ended after a '-' with no last range value
00494             CS_RUNTIME("end of range with no value for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00495                        CP(name_), C(cpus));
00496         break;
00497 
00498     case NONE:  // fall-through
00499     default:
00500         CS_RUNTIME("malformatted CPU list for cpuset '%s': '%s'",
00501                    CP(name_), C(cpus));
00502     }
00503 
00504     cpu_list->clear();
00505     const unsigned int size = CPUs_->size();
00506     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < size; ++i)
00507     {
00508         cpu = (*CPUs_)[i];
00509         char digits[cpu / 10 + 1 + 1];  // + 1 for comma, + 1 for '\0'
00510         if ((i + 1) < size)
00511             sprintf(digits, "%u,", cpu);// has comma
00512         else
00513             sprintf(digits, "%u", cpu); // No tailing comma
00514         (*cpu_list) += digits;
00515     }
00516     CS_CPRINT("String is '%s'\n",  CP(cpu_list));
00517 #endif
00518 }

00526 void
00527 cpuset::add_cpulist_to_cpuset(const std::string &cpulist)
00528 {
00529 
00530     std::string cmd(ECHO +  cpulist + X(" > ") + *path_ + "cpus");
00531     std::string mem_cmd(ECHO + cpulist + X(" > ") + *path_ + "mems");
00532 
00533     CS_CPRINT("Trying to execute '%s'\n", C(cmd));
00534     int ret = system(C(cmd));
00535     if (ret)
00536         CS_ERROR("%s: failed adding CPUs '%s'", CP(name_), C(cmd));
00537 
00538     CS_CPRINT("Trying to execute '%s'\n", C(mem_cmd));
00539     ret = system(C(mem_cmd));
00540     if (ret)
00541         CS_ERROR("%s: failed adding mems '%s'", CP(name_), C(mem_cmd));
00542 
00543 }

00553 void
00554 cpuset::add_task(pid_t pid)
00555 {
00556     int length = 0;
00557     for (pid_t x = pid ; x ; x /= 10)
00558         ++length; 
00559     
00560     char digits[length + 1];
00561     sprintf(digits, "%u", pid);
00562     std::string cmd(ECHO + X(digits) + X(" > tasks"));
00563 
00564     int ret = system(C(cmd));
00565     if (ret)
00566         CS_ERROR("%s: Failed adding task %u: %s", CP(name_), pid, C(cmd));
00567 
00568     pids_->push_back(pid);
00569 }
00570 
00575 std::string
00576 cpuset::print(void) const
00577 {
00578     std::ostringstream o;
00579     o << "name: " << *name_
00580       << "\npath: " << *path_;
00581 
00582     o << "\n#CPUs in set == " << CPUs_->size() << "\n";
00583     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < CPUs_->size(); ++i)
00584         o << (*CPUs_)[i] << " ";
00585 
00586     o << "\nProcesses in set == " << pids_->size() << "\n";
00587     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pids_->size(); ++i)
00588         o << (*pids_)[i] << " ";
00589 
00590     o << "\nCPU exclusive: " << (cpu_is_exclusive_ ? "Yes" : "No")
00591       << "\nmem exclusive: " << (mem_is_exclusive_ ? "Yes" : "No")
00592       << "\nmigrate memory: " << (migrate_memory_ ? "Yes" : "No")
00593       << "\nnotify on release: " << (notify_on_release_ ? "Yes" : "No") << "\n";
00594 
00595     if (parent_)
00596         o << "Child CPUset of '" << parent_->name() << "'\n";
00597     else
00598         o << "This is the root cpuset: no one's child\n";
00599 
00600     o << "Num child cpusets: " << children_.size() << "\n";
00601     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < children_.size(); ++i)
00602     {
00603         o << "[" << i << "]: \n"
00604           << DELIMITER << "\n"
00605           << *(children_[i]) << "\n"
00606           <<  DELIMITER << "\n";
00607     }
00608 
00609     return o.str();
00610 }
